value.title: Azure API for FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Michael Hansen joins Scott Hanselman to explain what FHIR is and how to get started with FHIR on Azure. Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (or, FHIR) is a new standard for representing and exchanging healthcare data. Developed by the HL7 community to address problems with interoperability, pieces
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/5vS7Iq9vpXE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to connect and deliver services privately on Azure with Azure Private Link | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Narayan Anamalai joins Donovan Brown to introduce Azure Private Link. In this episode, Narayan demonstrates how you can secure Azure PaaS resources and your Azure network using Private Link, and provide protection against data exfiltration.  8:45 - Demo  Azure Private Link overview https://aka.ms/azfr/610/01

value.title: How to deploy your web app using GitHub Actions | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, learn how to deploy Azure web apps using GitHub Actions.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com    Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal    And make sure to keep an eye on our Azure Portal "How to"

value.title: How to generate SSH public key to log into Linux VM | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn how to generate SSH public keys to log into a Linux VM with Cloud Shell and BASH on Windows 10. Watch how you can automatically log into a VM without having to put in a password if you SSH into the server.  For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips/

value.title: Planning Azure for SAP workloads
value.excerpt: As an IT Professional experienced in SAP solutions, you need to learn about how to leverage Azure resources that include virtual machines, virtual networks, storage accounts, and Azure AD. These modules will give you the Azure knowledge around the reference architecture for SAP Workloads, how to plan for the implementation of SAP solutions on Azure, and the preparation for your migration of SAP workloads to Azure.

topItems.title: Utilize Azure for SAP workloads reference architecture
topItems.excerpt: Utilize Azure for SAP Workloads Reference Architecture

topItems.title: Planning for implementing SAP solutions on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Planning for implementing SAP solutions on Azure

topItems.title: Prepare to migrate SAP workloads to Azure
topItems.excerpt: This module provides details on the important steps prior to deploying SAP workloads to Azure: project preparation and planning, pilot, non-production, production preparation, go live, and post production.

value.title: Add custom domain name to Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Learn how to add custom domain name to Azure Active Directory.

value.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value
value.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, use cases, and special factors of an enterprise AI strategy that creates real business value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

value.title: Analyze your Azure infrastructure by using Azure Monitor logs
value.excerpt: Use Azure Monitor logs to extract valuable information about your infrastructure from log data.

value.title: Microsoft Azure IoT strategy and solutions
value.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure IoT, and describes Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure. This knowledge can help bring IoT to life for your organization and customers.

value.title: Scale multiple Azure SQL Databases with SQL elastic pools
value.excerpt: Learn how to create SQL elastic pools and how to use them to manage performance and cost for a collection of SQL databases.

value.title: Build a scalable application with virtual machine scale sets
value.excerpt: Enable your application to automatically adjust to changes in load while minimizing costs with virtual machine scale sets.

value.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
value.excerpt: Learn how Azure's storage queues, event hubs, event grid, and service bus can improve your communication between devices.

value.title: Connect to virtual machines through the Azure portal by using Azure Bastion
value.excerpt: Learn how to deploy Azure Bastion to securely connect to Azure Virtual Machines directly within the Azure portal.

value.title: Describe Microsoft security and compliance principles
value.excerpt: Describe Microsoft security and compliance principles

value.title: Design an IP addressing schema for your Azure deployment
value.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to plan and implement an IP addressing scheme for virtual networks and virtual machines in Azure.

value.title: Detect and analyze faces with the Face service
value.excerpt: Face detection, analysis, and recognition is an important capability for artificial intelligence (AI) solutions. The Face cognitive service in Azure makes it easy integrate these capabilities into your applications.

value.title: Introduction to the Azure Machine Learning SDK
value.excerpt: Azure Machine Learning provides a cloud-based platform for training, deploying, and managing machine learning models.

value.title: Introduction to Azure Sentinel
value.excerpt: Get familiar with Azure Sentinel, a cloud-native, security information and event management (SIEM) service.

value.title: Keep your virtual machines updated
value.excerpt: Learn to use Azure Update Management to update virtual machines, verify agent connectivity, and use Azure Log Analytics in your cloud environment.

value.title: Load balance your web service traffic with Application Gateway
value.excerpt: Improve application resilience by distributing load across multiple servers and use path-based routing to direct web traffic.
